title: China loses UAE as partner for Chang’e-7 lunar south pole mission
summary: An agreement for a United Arab Emirates’ rover to fly on China’s Chang’e-7 lunar mission has apparently been hit by U.S. export control rules.

title: Advisory group backs European human spaceflight program using commercial approaches
summary: An advisory committee called on the European Space Agency to develop a comprehensive human spaceflight program using a more commercial approach.

title: Rocket Report: German launch company loses backer; Soyuz-5 may be in trouble
summary: “Shooting rockets off in the middle of Los Angeles or Dallas doesn’t make a lot of sense.”

title: First crewed Starliner launch slips again
summary: The first flight of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner commercial crew vehicle with astronauts on board, previously scheduled for late April, has been delayed, likely until the summer.

title: NASA warns of “devastating” impacts of potential budget cuts
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson claims proposed spending reductions for fiscal year 2024 could have “devastating and potentially unrecoverable” effects on NASA programs, delaying or canceling many missions.
